Cullen is correct in that Miran laid out an understandable argument for lowering rates. And it is because of the detail he gave that he CAN BE criticized. And, yes, I, too, have issues with his argument.

BUt before we get to that, let's give him props the for the detail and transperency. Too many other Fed officials provide a conclusion and a couple of platitudes and leave us guessing as to how they arrived at that conclusion.

It's a lot easier for me to write down numbers at this hour than other people's narratives
Quanta Computer's AI server head recently said that orders for Nvidia's $NVDA GB300 are "unimaginable" as the firm works to expand production capacity worldwide.

Bernstein estimates TSMC $TSM will report Q3 revenue above guidance, noting that July and August sales were equal to ~70% of Q3 guidance, above historical averages for 63-67%. 

Assuming September follows seasonal trends, Bernstein sees TSMC reporting Q3 nearly 8% above its guide.

$NVDA $AVGO $AMD
Nvidia $NVDA says the first 1GW will be deployed in the second half of 2026 on the Vera Rubin platform.

Oracle‚Äôs $ORCL Larry Ellison: 

‚ÄúTraining AI models is a gigantic multitrillion-dollar market. It's hard to conceive of a technology market as large as that one. But if you look close, you can find one that's even larger. And it's the market for AI inferencing.‚Äù

$NVDA $AMD
Broadcom $AVGO CEO Hock Tan is set to receive more than $600 million in stock awards if AI revenue climbs to $120 billion by 2030, or ~6x this year‚Äôs AI revenue.

CoreWeave $CRWV CEO Mike Intrator on AI demand: 

‚ÄúThe depth of the demand, the scale of the demand, the breadth of the demand is overwhelming. The industry‚Äôs capacity to deliver the compute that is required by OpenAI, by the hyperscalers, by the enterprise, by the sovereigns ‚Äì it‚Äôs just layer after layer of overwhelming demand.‚Äù

$NVDA $MSFT $GOOG $AMZN
Barclays on Alibaba‚Äôs $BABA cloud growth: ‚ÄúWe expect cloud revenue growth to continue to accelerate from 26% year-over-year in the June-quarter in coming quarters with stable margins.‚Äù

Nvidia $NVDA is planning to invest up to $100 billion into OpenAI, enabling OpenAI to build and deploy 10GW of AI data centers featuring millions of Nvidia GPUs.

Nvidia's investments will progress as each GW is deployed.

Google $GOOG revealed that it expects to recognize 55% of its $106 billion backlog as revenue for Google Cloud, or ~$58 billion.

For context, Google Cloud recently surpassed a $50 billion annual run rate with revenue of $13.6 billion last quarter.
